Brave cancer survivor Andrea Hollingsworth has revealed her new nose and incredible transformation for years after first appearing on ITV's This Morning . 
The mum-of-three was devastated when surgery to remove a tumour left her losing half her face as he looks were drastically altered. 
Undetected skin cancer had caused the disfigurement, but Andrea is looking to the future after previously being too upset to look into mirrors at her home. She appeared on This Morning four years ago (Photo: ITV) Andrea had just a 20% chance of survival (Photo: ITV) She was showing off her new nose (Photo: ITV) 
After eight new noses, she admitted the journey isn't over yet. 
"It's just the colour, the colour's not right," she told Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield of the latest prosthetic. "People still stare." Andrea and her daughter Gemma (Photo: ITV) 
Andrea and divorced welder Corrie met at his home in March 2014 as she didn’t want to go out in public. The family have given their support (Photo: ITV) They were open about the difficulties (Photo: ITV) 
She told the Sunday People last year: “There was a big bunch of flowers outside his front door. We sat there talking. He’s very quiet, so different to me, but the conversation flowed from the beginning. 
"I think that’s when we both knew. That October, we went into a jeweller’s to order an ­engagement ring.” 
Andrea, who recently received a six figure payout due to NHS delays in her diagnosis, has several more ops to improve her face and has cancer check-ups every six months. Like us on Facebook
